valerypopoffjsplugin.name: ValerypopoffJS
valerypopoffjsplugin.description: Use javascript functions, get and set object properties and call object methods. Keep event sheets for high-level logic. Implement game objects, and algorithms in javascript.

Scriptfiles.name: Script files
Scriptfiles.desc: Javascript files to include to the game.

c2-compare-function-return-value.description: Call JS function and compare its return value (does NOT store return value).

js-function-name.name: JS function name (no parentheses)
js-function-name.desc: Enter JS function name to call.

js-function-parameters.name: Parameter {n}
js-function-parameters.desc: Parameter to pass to the function.

c2-compare-cell-call-return-value.description: Call JS function behind the alias expression and compare its return value (does NOT store return value).

cell-call-parameters.name: Parameter {n}
cell-call-parameters.desc: Parameter to pass to the function.

c2-compare-exec-return-with-parameters.description: Compare completion value of JS code with optional parameters (does NOT store return value). This condition uses eval.

js-code.name: JS code
js-code.desc: JS string that will be executed with eval. You can include parameters into the string using #-entries like this: #0, #1, #2 ... #999. The string will be parsed and all #-entries will be replaced with respective parameter values.

js-parameters.name: Parameter {n}
js-parameters.desc: Parameter to pass to the code.

compare-exec-return-with-parameters.description: Compare completion value of JS code with optional parameters (does NOT store return value). This condition uses eval.

js-code.name: JS code
js-code.desc: JS string that will be executed with eval. You can include parameters into the string using #-entries like this: #0, #1, #2 ... #999. The string will be parsed and all #-entries will be replaced with respective parameter values.

js-parameters.name: Parameter {n}
js-parameters.desc: Parameter to pass to the code.

compare-function-return-value.description: Call JS function and compare its return value (does NOT store return value).

js-function-name.name: JS function name (no parentheses)
js-function-name.desc: Enter JS function name to call.

js-function-parameters.name: Parameter {n}
js-function-parameters.desc: Parameter to pass to the function.

compare-stored-return-value.description: Compare last stored return value after actions.

all-scripts-loaded.description: Check if all scripts are loaded.

compare-cell-value.description: Compare the value behind the alias expression.

compare-cell-call-return-value.description: Call JS function behind the alias expression and compare its return value (does NOT store return value).

cell-call-parameters.name: Parameter {n}
cell-call-parameters.desc: Parameter to pass to the function.

execute-js-with-parameters.description: Execute JS code with optional parameters and store returned completion value. This action uses eval.

js-code.name: JS code
js-code.desc: JS string that will be executed with eval. You can include parameters into the string using #-entries like this: #0, #1, #2 ... #999. The string will be parsed and all #-entries will be replaced with respective parameter values.

js-parameters.name: Parameter {n}
js-parameters.desc: Parameter to pass to the code.

call-js-function.description: Call JS function with optional parameters and store its return value.

js-function-name.name: JS function name (no parentheses)
js-function-name.desc: Enter JS function name to call.

js-function-parameters.name: Parameter {n}
js-function-parameters.desc: Parameter to pass to the function.

cell-js.name: JS
cell-js.desc: What the alias is associated with in JS.

cell-value.name: Value
cell-value.desc: Value to set the alias expression to.

call-cell.description: Call the function behind alias expression and store its return value.

js-function-parameters.name: Parameter {n}
js-function-parameters.desc: Parameter to pass to the function.

get-js-execution-return.description: Execute JS code with optional parameters and get its completion value right away (it will NOT store this value). This expression uses eval.

js-code.name: JS code
js-code.desc: This expression uses eval. Enter JS string (it will be executed with eval) and optional parameters. If you pass parameters, include them into the string using #-entries like this: #0, #1, #2 ... #999. The string will be parsed and all #-entries will be replaced with respective parameter values.

get-stored-execution-return.description: Get stored return value after actions

function-return-value.description: Call JS function with optional parameters and get its return value right away (it will NOT store this value).

func-name.name: JS function name (no parentheses)
func-name.desc: Enter JS function name to call.

get-alias-call-value.description: Call the function behind alias expression with optional parameters and get its return value right away (it will NOT store this value).
